subject: Public Speaking
title: Bolivar's Jamaica Letter
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bolivar's Jamaica Letter.

hook.text: Exiled and nearly broke in Jamaica, Simon Bolivar wrote a letter that became Latin America's manifesto.

buildup.text: The Jamaica Letter laid out a vision: independent republics across South America, free from Spanish rule.

discovery.text: Bolivar predicted specific nations, borders, and challenges with remarkable accuracy â€” decades before they existed.

twist.text: The letter was addressed to one person but written for the world. It circulated across continents.

climax.text: Within ten years, Bolivar had liberated six nations. The letter became the blueprint he actually followed.

punchline.text: One exile's letter redrew a continent's map.

quiz.question: What did Bolivar's Jamaica Letter accomplish?
options: It outlined a vision for independent South American republics
